comments.body: Thanks @linev , is this something we need to do every time we draw, or we could do it once when we enable JSRoot in the notebook?

It can be done once after first loading of `JSRootCore` module. 
But it does not make any big difference - it is just global JSROOT settings and can be configured at any time before next `JSROOT.draw()` call
Would it be possible/easy to do it once after loading `JSRootCore`? I understand the effect is the same, but it is just not to have the assignment done every time we draw if once is enough.
But `JSRootCore` module loaded only immediately before first draw - it does not exists before.
So this will try first to use a locally installed JSRoot, then the rest of the options in the list?
Yes, require.js will try in this order
I just add drawing of the object directly

I understand compression `23` is the maximum:
https://root.cern.ch/doc/master/classTBufferJSON.html#a38d20878d3af12bb03c4da37f4960ad3
I think the `3` is missing in the list for the second digit in the documentation of `ConvertToJSON`, though.

Perhaps we can add a comment here saying we apply maximum compression to the JSON?
I will update docu - it should be 10 for "exclude leading and trailing zeros" and 20 for "searching and removing gaps"

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +320,324 @@   ROOT.TColor.DefinedColors()

   canvas_json = ROOT.TBufferJSON.ConvertToJSON(canvas, 23)

   # Cleanup primitives after conversion

comments.body: `can.__smartptr__().get()` should not be necessary as `can` should already behave as an RCanvas, can you try just constructing with `NotebookDrawer(can)`?
I tried - it does not work. Copy of `shared_ptr` does not work properly.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +416,420 @@    if not RCanvasAvailable(): return []
    lOfC = ROOT.Experimental.RCanvas.GetCanvases()
    return [NotebookDrawer(can.__smartptr__().get()) for can in lOfC if can.IsShown()]

def GetGeometryDrawer():

comments.body: Just to be more concise, I'd just do `self.isRCanvas = hasattr(self.drawableObject,"ResolveSharedPtrs")` here and leave the `self.isCanvas` assignment as it was.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +473,477 @@    def __init__(self, theObject):
        self.drawableObject = theObject
        self.isRCanvas = False
        self.isCanvas = False
        if hasattr(self.drawableObject,"ResolveSharedPtrs"):

comments.body: What is this setting used for? I guess it does not have any effect in the old graphics.
This is needed for `RWebWindow` - otherwise it will create `THttpServer` and will try to popup another web browser

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +38,42 @@# We want iPython to take over the graphics
ROOT.gROOT.SetBatch()
ROOT.gROOT.SetWebDisplay("jupyter")

cppMIME = 'text/x-c++src'
